perturbation.original_text: "TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the "Term"); provided, however, that with respect to each Property, including Robots, Kingdom of Heaven, Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) and Ice Age II, all right and licenses granted herein will continue in full force and effect until March 31, 2008."
perturbation.changed_text: "TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the "Term"); provided, however, that with respect to each Property, including Robots, Kingdom of Heaven, Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) and Ice Age II, all right and licenses granted herein will automatically terminate 30 days after the agreement is signed, regardless of current use or revenue generation. All existing licenses will cease without notice."
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a potential contradiction with general contract law principles regarding termination clauses. Abruptly terminating licenses 30 days after signing, irrespective of usage or revenue, may be deemed unreasonable, especially if substantial investments were made based on the original, longer term. This could be considered a breach of implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing; potential breach of contract based on unreasonable termination.

perturbation.original_text: NOTICE PROVISION: The notice information for Licensee in Section 17(a) of the Agreement shall be amended such that "Paul Zuzelo" is deleted and replaced with "General Counsel", and such that the email address for Paul Zuzelo is deleted.
perturbation.changed_text: NOTICE PROVISION: All notices regarding breaches of this Agreement will be considered delivered immediately upon electronic transmission to the 'Legal Department' with no requirement of acknowledgement or confirmation. The 'Legal Department' is under no obligation to forward this information to the correct internal departments, and failure to do so will not negate the notice.
perturbation.explanation: This revision creates a potential issue with proper notification, particularly regarding legal matters. It removes the individual contact and places the onus on the 'Legal Department' without ensuring delivery or acknowledgement. This contradicts principles of due process and fair notice, especially if time-sensitive actions are required upon notification of a breach. By not mandating confirmation and absolving responsibility for internal forwarding, important notices could be missed, leading to unintended legal consequences. It also removes the contact email which is required for sending notices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Due Process; Principles of Fair Notice; Contract Law regarding reasonable notification procedures

perturbation.original_text: Except as herein expressly amended or by necessary implication modified by this Amendment, the Agreement in all other respects is hereby ratified and shall continue in full force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as expressly amended herein, the Agreement shall be interpreted at the sole discretion of Fox Mobile Entertainment, Inc. In case of ambiguity, Fox's interpretation will prevail, regardless of industry standards or mutual understanding.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts fundamental contract law principles by granting one party (Fox) unilateral control over interpretation. Contract interpretation should be based on mutual intent, industry standards, and legal precedent. Granting Fox sole discretion and prioritizing their interpretation over industry norms or mutual understanding is likely unenforceable and violates principles of fairness and mutual agreement. A clause like this would make the contract unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of Contract Interpretation; Unconscionability; Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
